revised_title: Age and Relationships of the Chillesford Clay: Early Pleistocene Stratigraphy in Suffolk, England
tldr: This study investigates the Chillesford Clay in Suffolk, England, examining its distribution, lithology, heavy mineral composition, magnetic polarity, and pollen, foraminifera, mollusc, and dinoflagellate cyst assemblages. The research clarifies the clay's stratigraphic position and provides insights into the relationships between the Bramertonian, Baventian, and Pre-Pastonian stages of the early Pleistocene.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Stratigraphy and Paleontology
